definition: towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: Even introverts know what loneliness feels like.
sentences.chinese: 就算是性格內向的人，也知道孤獨是什麼滋味。

sentences.english: Let’s take the example of an introvert and an extrovert.
sentences.chinese: 我們用性格內向和外向的人舉個例子。

sentences.english: In the INTJ pattern, the tertiary process is for introverted Feeling.
sentences.chinese: 在INTJ模式下，第三功能是內向感覺。

sentences.english: The content introverts' camp closely borders the land of the socially anxious.
sentences.chinese: 內向者的營地將社交焦慮的領地壁壘森嚴地包圍起來。

sentences.english: The video details a systematic process for developing the crawl stroke "from the inside out."
sentences.chinese: 視頻詳述了發展爬泳的系統過程“從內向外。”

sentences.english: Mathematically, it is the solution of a harmonic inward continuation problem.
sentences.chinese: 數學上，它是調和函數內向連續問題。

sentences.english: No bathhouse shall be open to the public except between the hours of6o'clock in the forenoon and midnight.
sentences.chinese: 浴室只可在上午6時至午夜此段時間內向公衆開放。

sentences.english: This usage makes the extrovert and the introvert seem to stand for opposed personality types.
sentences.chinese: 你覺得你的個性是傾於外向，還是內向？

sentences.english: We all know the subject of his introversion .
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道他性格內向的話題。

sentences.english: Thus, while the U. S. might value extraverts, other cultures value introverted personality.
sentences.chinese: 因此，美國較看重外向者，而其他文化則重視內向的。

sentences.english: I used to be incredibly introverted.
Introverts tend to be much more even-keeled and level than extroverts.
sentences.chinese: 相比外向的人而言，內向的人更容易平靜下來。

sentences.english: China will continue to offer Papua New Guinea assistance within its available resources.
sentences.chinese: 中方將繼續在力所能及的範圍內向巴新提供援助。

sentences.english: Darnay asked the postmaster, when he had thanked him, and stood beside him in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 達爾內向驛站長道了謝，跟他一起站在院子裏時問道。
我就是一個性格內向的人。

definition: spacious and well-lit/open and clear/(of character) optimistic/cheerful/carefree
to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
(coll.) outwardly cold or retiring but deep and passionate inside
